subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of mtDNA mutations caused by ROS, mitochondrial dynamics, and energy depletion linking mtDNA damage and oxidative stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on mtDNA mutation accumulation, heteroplasmy, and integration with free radical damage causing mitochondrial dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial fusion-fission cycles affecting mtDNA mutant clonal expansion and quality control, linking mtDNA mutations and ROS.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mtDNA mutation accumulation, ROS-induced damage, and mathematical modeling of mitochondrial population dynamics.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress causing mtDNA mutations and deletions, affecting electron transport chain and mitochondrial function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details mtDNA mutation accumulation impairing respiratory chain complexes and mitochondrial enzyme function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Mitochondrial Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS as causal agents of aging and oxidative damage driving mitochondrial and cardiac aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Includes mtDNA mutations, ROS damage, mitochondrial quality control decline, and retrograde signaling linking mitochondrial dysfunction to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Mitochondrial Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial free radicals causing mtDNA damage, especially complex I dysfunction, and antioxidant defense roles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mtDNA mutation accumulation, defective oxidative phosphorylation, ROS vicious cycle, and apoptosis involvement.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mtDNA damage and ROS vicious cycle, phenotypic threshold effects, and respiratory chain dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS production, mtDNA mutations, energetic decline, and ROS self-amplifying damage cycle.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Mitochondrial Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative mtDNA damage, repair mechanisms, and heterogeneity in damage distribution.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes somatic mtDNA mutation accumulation, mitochondrial functional decline, ROS damage, and tissue-specific vulnerability.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA mutation accumulation, defective electron transport chain, especially complex I, and increased oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Complex II Dysfunction and ROS Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on complex II mutation causing increased ROS production, oxidative stress, and accelerated aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Metabolic Decline and TCA Cycle Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial functional decline with age, TCA cycle metabolite imbalance, and metabolic flux changes predicting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Mitochondrial Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative damage leading to intervertebral disc degeneration and tissue dysfunction.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mtDNA damage by free radicals, defective mitochondrial function, oxidative damage, and dietary modulation of membranes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mtDNA mutation/inactivation in differentiated cells as primary aging cause, emphasizing vulnerability and bioenergetic decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation and ROS Feedback Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial damage accumulation, ROS production, energetic decline, and mitochondrial regulation of apoptosis.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage causing mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS-induced mtDNA mutations, and feedback loops accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction caused by environmental toxins leading to metabolic syndrome and vascular remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Hormesis and Adaptive ROS Signaling Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes transient mitochondrial ROS as beneficial signals triggering adaptive stress responses and longevity promotion.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of defective mitochondria due to delayed degradation, clonal expansion, and mitochondrial population dynamics.
